OnlyFans Content Creation Guidelines – What is allowed and what’s not?

Estimated Reading Time: 6 min 25 sec

Are you frequently stuck between deciding what content to post and what not to post on OnlyFans? You’re not alone! Many content creators get the knack for posting, publishing, or uploading new content frequently but are constantly pulled back by the thought that they might be going against the rules, especially when it comes to content related to sexuality, nudity, and other aspects.

Luckily, OnlyFans has carefully listed a handful of rules for users to work with, so you can be sure to stay out of harm’s way with your content. But here’s where the problem lies, not every content creator has the time to go through a long list of terms. And while the rules may seem rather pesky and long, they can be quite confusing too.

So, if you’re like most content creators or models on this platform who don’t have the luxury of carefully going through the almost endless list.

In that case, this article will lead you through what’s allowed and what’s not on OnlyFans and guide you through the do’s and don’ts of content creation, audience engagements, promotions, and upscaling your fan base on OnlyFans.

Make an appointment now

Basic Guidelines For Creating content on OnlyFans

Creating content on OnlyFans is quite easy and interesting, as creators have various options to tailor their content. Generally, the type of content you can create on OnlyFans is categorized into three groups;

  • Pictures & photo sets
  • Videos
  • Voice notes

Creators can create content under the above categories as long as the content adheres to the rules on this platform.

What’s allowed on OnlyFans

Nude & Sexual content

OnlyFans owes the majority of its success to sexual content. Basically, the platform is commonly known as an adult streaming site. However, it’s not entirely filled with porno and X-rated content. So as a model or creator on this platform who intends to gain more attention with explicit content, you should understand your limits and the things you’re allowed to act out or include in your content. Moving further, here’s a list of things you’re allowed to do;

  • OnlyFans consent to verified creators posting or uploading photos or videos of themselves in bikinis or lingerie in public.
  • Naked pictures or videos of yourself in private are also allowed on OnlyFans. This can be in places like your private backyard or private property. As long as no one else is sure to see it, it is okay to take naked pictures or videos of yourself in such places.
  • OnlyFans also allows creators to take naked pictures or videos of themselves with another verified creator. Most times, creators may require an extra person to make their Content. In this case, they can include another verified creator in their picture or videos as long as they have their consent.
  • Verified users or creators on the platform are also allowed to upload naked pictures of themselves in public only if it adheres to OnlyFans rules- i.e. if it is in a natural surrounding with no expectations of other people seeing it.
  • Erotic toys are also allowed on OnlyFans. Verified creators on OnlyFans can post or upload pictures and videos of themselves with erotic toys.
  • Creators on OnlyFans can also post pictures, and videos of themselves engaged in physical activity with another creator.
  • Nude or semi-nude pictures or videos of your body parts are also allowed on OnlyFans once you become a verified member. OnlyFans offers creators freedom and flexibility when it comes to content creation.

#Bonus tip: Fandafia can help you achieve virality and boost your earnings with industry-proven content strategies and tips. So whether you’re an aspiring content creator, a model, or a verified creator on OnlyFans, you can reach your desired goals with the aid of an expert agency.

Non Sexual content

  • When creating content on OnlyFans, creators can be allowed to post pictures or videos of themselves clothed in public.
  • For co-authored posts, content creators and co-authors are allowed to post and upload pictures or videos of themselves clothed in public; as long as the other person is a verified creator on OnlyFans.
  • As a verified creator on OnlyFans, you can create text posts if they do not harass, discriminate, or contain hate speech and other social vices.
  • Along with text posts, Audio messages or voice notes are also allowed here and must be void of hate speech, harassment, and other social vices.

Regular content

While this site has garnered much fame over the years with its extreme dedication to adult content, not every creator on OnlyFans is interested in adult content. It may seem quite surprising, but a handful of creators on this platform make an honest living creating content in the following niches;

  • fitness/workout
  • cooking recipes
  • make-up tutorials
  • Music Lessons

Basically, creators can have content made on virtually anything as long as it’s legal and follows the rules on this platform.

Make an appointment now

What’s not allowed on Onlyfans

Let’s get down to what’s not allowed on this platform. The list of things you’re not allowed to include in your content is similar to what you find on other social platforms. Simply put, your content should not include illegal or prohibited items, immorality, social vices, etc. Read here to find what you should avoid when creating your content on OnlyFans.

Social Crimes & Vices

OnlyFans frowns seriously over several social crimes on its platform. However, most of these rules are quite the same as those on similar sites, so there’s no reason you should worry. The platform’s rules clearly state that creators are not allowed to post, upload, publish or display content on OnlyFans that are,

  • Illegal
  • Fraudulent
  • Hateful
  • Defamatory
  • Threatening
  • Harassing
  • Discriminatory
  • Encourages violence or any illegal activity.

The underage rule

The rules on OnlyFans expressively state that content on OnlyFans should in no way exploit, harm, or even attempt to exploit underage persons (persons under 18). Additionally, your content should not show, refer or involve individuals or groups of people who are below 18.

Involving other people in your content

Posting content with underage persons on OnlyFans isn’t the only thing that will get you into trouble. In fact, including other unverified individuals (Above 18) is another thing that causes you some issues.

Therefore, OnlyFans requires that if you must include other persons in your content, you must ensure they’re a verified creator and have written documentation stating therein that the persons involved are above 18 and have consented to use images, names, or video recordings involving them.

Promotions, advertising, or making content that involves prohibited items

While OnlyFans isn’t the only platform with a firm rule regarding illegal items, it’s pretty much a straightforward rule.

The terms of use state that content creators cannot show, involve or promote the following items while on the platform; Firearms, weapons, and pretty much every good considered prohibited or restricted, such as drugs and drug paraphernalia.

Make an appointment now

Immorality and Unlawful Conduct

OnlyFans urges its creators to desist from featuring many immoral and unlawful acts on its platform. To this end, avoid any engagement in the following acts;

  1. Violence and violence-related conduct (hitting, shoving, pushing or kicking, destruction of property, vandalism, sabotage, violent related pranks, etc.)
  2. Incest (having sexual intercourse with a parent, child, sibling, grandchild, or anyone classed as being too closely related)
  3. Lack of consent (all forms, including taking a picture, recording, involving personal details, etc., Without prior consent from the person(s) involved)
  4. Torture
  5. Sexual assault
  6. Revenge porn
  7. Sadomasochistic abuse
  8. Urine, scatological or excrement-related substances
  9. Extreme fisting
  10. Hardcore bondage
  11. Hypnosis
  12. Intoxication (either by alcohol, drugs, or anything in-between)
  13. Genital mutilation
  14. Sex trafficking, prostitution, or escort services
  15. All forms of hate speech

Other things you can’t do on OnlyFans

Although this part doesn’t relate closely to content creation, still they’re worth paying close attention to.

Linking to OnlyFans

OnlyFans does not allow linking to its homepage if the link in any way depicts a form of association, endorsement, or approval with/from OnlyFans.

Promoting your OnlyFans account using search engine advertising services

OnlyFans prohibits using search engine advertising services such as Google Ads or other similar advertising platforms to promote your account.

Selling, sharing, renting your account, or content obtained from using OnlyFans is not allowed

Quite the restriction, yeah? It’s normal to feel the urge to share your OnlyFans content with others. However, this is a huge No from OnlyFans as you could be sharing content with an unverified or underage person at the very worst. Well, unless your account is being managed by an agency with your consent.

Make an appointment now

Advertising Guidelines on OnlyFans; what’s allowed and what’s not

Creating and posting content on Onlyfans isn’t the only part that requires you to follow set rules. And while you may think otherwise, promotions and advertising on this platform also have acceptable terms of use.

If you in any way intend to use OnlyFans to advertise third-party goods, services, or images which you will, in turn, receive payment for, then there are certain rules you must follow.

Here’s a list of actions that are not allowed when advertising on OnlyFans

  1. OnlyFans doesn’t allow creators to advertise cigarettes or other forms of tobacco products on its platform. This list spans cross tobacco or even tobacco products like electronic cigarettes and refill containers. Also, you cannot advertise any form of illegal drugs or prescription-only medicines on OnlyFans.
  2. Advertising or promotion of illegal gambling.
  3. Advertising alcoholic content aimed at minors or encouraging the consumption of alcohol in an immoderate fashion.
  4. Adverts that promote or include sex discrimination, racial or ethnic origin discrimination, and discrimination based on religion, nationality, belief, age, sexual orientation, and disability.
  5. Advertising content that encourages behaviors that are harmful or deemed detrimental to health and safety.
  6. Advertising content that promotes or encourages behaviors that pose a threat or are detrimental to protecting the environment.
  7. Advertising content that imposes mental, physical, or moral harm to any person.
  8. Advertising or promoting content that compels people to purchase or rent goods or services by taking advantage of their ignorance or inexperience.
  9. Advertising content that is sensitive to people. For instance, if an ad unreasonably shows a person or persons in a dangerous situation, don’t upload this content on OnlyFans.

Do you want to achieve success on OnlyFans?

These days growing fame and increasing your revenue on sites like OnlyFans can be quite difficult; we’re talking daily engagements, content, account growth, and revenue building, especially if you’re a model or an upcoming creator.

You can always take your chances by working your way up to the ropes or hiring our agency to assist you. We will leverage the tips and proven strategies plus effective content planning to help you gain virality in no time.
